content:
• Monday, June 11, 2012
  • STX

    Seagate (STX -3.6%) +2.5% AH after the company discloses David Einhorn has increased his stake...

    Seagate (STX -3.6%) +2.5% AH after the company discloses David Einhorn has increased his stake to 23M shares, or about 5.4% of the company. According to his firm's latest 13-F, Einhorn's stake stood at 14.5M shares at the end of Q1. Seagate's low valuation (it trades at just 2.4x estimated FY13 EPS) likely has something to do with Einhorn's interest.
     
     
     
     
    | 6:26 PM | 9 Comments
  • TXN

    Texas Instruments (TXN -3.1%) uses its mid-quarter update to narrow its Q2 revenue and EPS...

    Texas Instruments (TXN -3.1%) uses its mid-quarter update to narrow its Q2 revenue and EPS guidance ranges. The chipmaker now expects revenue of $3.28B-$3.42B ($3.22B-$3.48B prior) and EPS of $0.32-$0.36 ($0.30-$0.38 prior). Shares +1.2% AH. A CC starts at 5PM ET (webcast). (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 4:39 PM | 1 Comment
  • NFLX

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) content starts to come out of a dry spell with the streaming addition of...

    Netflix (NASDAQ:NFLX) content starts to come out of a dry spell with the streaming addition of Thor and next month's planned additions of blockbusters Transformers: Dark of the Moon and Captain America: The First Avenger. February's expiration of deals with Starz and Disney hasn't helped subscriber growth, which takes a toll on the stock - down 4% today and down 42% in three months.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:14 PM | 3 Comments
  • FNSR

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $239.9M (+1.3% Y/Y) beats by...

    Finisar (NASDAQ:FNSR): FQ4 EPS of $0.23 beats by $0.02. Revenue of $239.9M (+1.3% Y/Y) beats by $3M. Shares -3.2% AH. (PR)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM
  • JIVE

    Interestingly, Jive Software (JIVE +3.9%) has closed with a solid gain on IPO lock-up expiration...

    Interestingly, Jive Software (JIVE +3.9%) has closed with a solid gain on IPO lock-up expiration day, even though 75% of outstanding shares were covered by the lock-up provision. Two likely reasons why: 1) Jive had fallen 42% from its early-April high, partly on lock-up expiration fears. 2) Short-sellers are looking for reasons to cover (17.2% of Jive's float was shorted as of May 15).

     
     
     
     
    | 4:03 PM | 1 Comment
  • NEWL

    Shipping company NewLead Holdings (NEWL -20.1%) says it will convert $217M of debt owed to a...

    Shipping company NewLead Holdings (NEWL -20.1%) says it will convert $217M of debt owed to a company controlled by CEO Michael Zolotas into nearly 265M common shares in a deal valuing NEWL at $0.82/share, a 41% discount to its Friday close of $1.39. Once issued, NEWL will have a total of ~285M shares of common stock outstanding.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:57 PM
  • SKX

    Skechers (SKX +3.3%) is over the hump, Sterne Agee says following conversations with the shoe...

    Skechers (SKX +3.3%) is over the hump, Sterne Agee says following conversations with the shoe company's management and other industry types at the New York Shoe Show. The firm bumps SKX to a Buy and raises its estimates, citing "very attractive" new Go Walk shoes and other product offerings, as well as domestic and international growth.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:49 PM | 1 Comment
  • XOM

    Crude slides another dollar near a weekly low (now -2.6% to $82) as Saudi Arabia's oil minister...

    Crude slides another dollar near a weekly low (now -2.6% to $82) as Saudi Arabia's oil minister hints at higher production as he arries for OPEC meetings. "That's not what I said... Maybe. Maybe it will be lower." Producers trim gains or head further into red: XOM -0.2%, CVX -0.6%, MRO -1.4%, OXY -1.5%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM
  • ARCH

    Thermal coal prices fall to a two-year low as surging exports from Indonesia, the world’s...

    Thermal coal prices fall to a two-year low as surging exports from Indonesia, the world’s largest coal producer, and the U.S. continue to overwhelm demand from Asia. The slide hits the share price of thermal coal miners (KOL -1.5%), with the valuation of some approaching their lowest in more a decade: ACI -2.1%, ANR -7.5%, BTU -4%, PCX -11.7%, JRCC -6.8%.

     
     
     
     
    | 3:09 PM | 9 Comments

  • Phillips 66 ([[PSX] +2.4%) CEO Greg Garland says the company may invest in a second large new...

    Phillips 66 ([[PSX] +2.4%) CEO Greg Garland says the company may invest in a second large new chemical plant in the Gulf of Mexico to benefit from the cheap feedstock unlocked by the North American shale revolution. “After the Middle East, the U.S. is the next best place to make petrochemicals, because of the advantaged feedstock, and we see that continuing for some time," Garland says.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:55 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    As expected, Apple's (AAPL +0.5%) iOS 6 will have built-in Facebook (FB +2.1%) integration....

    As expected, Apple's (AAPL +0.5%) iOS 6 will have built-in Facebook (FB +2.1%) integration. Features include the ability to "Like" iTunes content, post status updates from the notification menu, and directly share content from apps. Also announced (live blog) is Apple's new mapping solution (no more Google Maps), which features 3D models of cities and turn-by-turn navigation - the latter is leading to further weakness (previous) in Garmin (GRMN -7.6%).

     
     
     
     
    | 2:53 PM | 3 Comments
  • MRK

    Investors apparently aren't too impressed with Cubist Pharmaceuticals' (CBST -2.6%) new...

    Investors apparently aren't too impressed with Cubist Pharmaceuticals' (CBST -2.6%) new five-year strategic plan. CBST says it expects to boost global revenue to $2B annually, have four product candidates in late-stage clinical trials, and generate $700M in non-GAAP annual adjusted operating income.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:29 PM | 1 Comment
  • ES-OLD

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD -53.1%) shares are selling off after the nuclear industry service...

    EnergySolutions (ES-OLD -53.1%) shares are selling off after the nuclear industry service provider lowered its earnings outlook for the year and named David Lockwood as its new CEO.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:22 PM
  • OPEN

    OpenTable (OPEN +3.2%) rallies after Apple discloses OpenTable's restaurant-booking service is...

    OpenTable (OPEN +3.2%) rallies after Apple discloses OpenTable's restaurant-booking service is now integrated with Siri. Yelp (YELP +1.4%), which is already built into Siri, has also caught a bid.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:21 PM
  • OCR

    Omnicare (OCR -7.4%) shares tumble after the healthcare services company's CEO John Figueroa...

    Omnicare (OCR -7.4%) shares tumble after the healthcare services company's CEO John Figueroa abruptly quits, and the company provides no explanation. CFO John Workman, will serve as interim CEO as the board searches for a permanent replacement.

     
     
     
     
    | 2:02 PM
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain (GMCR -7%) tumbles as Kroger reportedly plans to sell store-branded single-serve...

    Green Mountain (GMCR -7%) tumbles as Kroger reportedly plans to sell store-branded single-serve coffee cups compatible with Green Mountain's Keurig brewers (earlier). The move isn't a surprise, says an analyst, but actually seeing on paper that a major retailer is going to compete with your product still has plenty of shock value.

     
     
     
     
    | 1:48 PM | 2 Comments
  • AAPL

    Tim Cook announces Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) expected MacBook refresh during his keynote at the...

    Tim Cook announces Apple's (NASDAQ:AAPL) expected MacBook refresh during his keynote at the Worldwide Developers Conference (live blog). New MacBook Pro and Air models sporting Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) Ivy Bridge processors are introduced, including a $2,199, 15.4" MacBook Pro featuring a retina display with a 2880x1880 resolution. Nvidia (NVDA +4.1%) is rallying on news that the 15" Pro models (retina display or otherwise) will contain the company's graphics processors (previous).

     
     
     
     
    | 1:32 PM | 36 Comments
  • GWW

    W.W. Grainger (GWW -3.8%) shares slip after the industrial maintenance and safety products...

    W.W. Grainger (GWW -3.8%) shares slip after the industrial maintenance and safety products supplier reports May 2012 sales increased 13% Y/Y boosted by contributions from acquisitions, with June growth up so far in "low double digits" but not as strong as May. Daily sales rose 8% in the U.S., 9% in Canada and 86% in the rest of the world.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:51 PM
  • WPRT

    After visiting Westport Innovations’ (WPRT -2.2%) Chinese joint venture, Piper Jaffray...

    After visiting Westport Innovations’ (WPRT -2.2%) Chinese joint venture, Piper Jaffray says it has more confidence in its estimates for the company thanks to significant benefits from the aggressive shift of China's truck market to natural gas. The firm reiterates its Overweight rating and price target of $45.50.

     
     
     
     
    | 12:21 PM | 4 Comments
  • TPLM

    In its latest operational update, Triangle Petroleum (TPLM -5.1%) reports Q1 revenues +908% Y/Y...

    In its latest operational update, Triangle Petroleum (TPLM -5.1%) reports Q1 revenues +908% Y/Y to $5.2M and production +824% Y/Y to 62,700 boe. Well results: four gross operated wells in McKenzie County, all completed in May, with two wells currently producing and two undergoing flowback testing.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:59 AM | 1 Comment
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (DMND -6.5%) faces being delisted after saying it would miss today's extended...

    Diamond Foods (DMND -6.5%) faces being delisted after saying it would miss today's extended deadline for refiling its earnings reports, as it's out of compliance with Nasdaq's requirements. Diamond also expects that it won't be able to hold its annual meeting by July 31, as also required.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:50 AM
  • VRTX

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.2%) is looking for a new head of its commercial team after...

    Vertex Pharmaceuticals (VRTX -3.2%) is looking for a new head of its commercial team after reporting late Friday that Chief Commercial Officer Nancy Wysenksi will retire. The departure comes after VRTX last month revealed it had released incorrect clinical data that overstated the benefit of a cystic fibrosis therapy.

     
     
     
     
    | 11:49 AM | 1 Comment
  • CTRP

    Chinese travel bookings site Ctrip.com (CTRP -7.2%) dives on a downgrade to Hold from Mirae,...

    Chinese travel bookings site Ctrip.com (CTRP -7.2%) dives on a downgrade to Hold from Mirae, which thinks a decision by rival Qunar (majority-owned by BIDU) to sell hotel room inventory held by wholesalers online could pose a threat to Ctrip's business. Mirae adds weakening economic conditions are driving wholesalers to sell more of their inventory online, and that Ctrip will struggle to cope.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:26 AM
  • TFM

    Fresh Market (TFM -4.9%) slides after the high-end grocer announces a 10M-share secondary...

    Fresh Market (TFM -4.9%) slides after the high-end grocer announces a 10M-share secondary offering of its common stock worth ~$525M by members of the founding Berry family. Following the sale, the family will own 21% of TFM's outstanding shares. TFM won't get any of the proceeds from the secondary offering.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:53 AM
  • DUK

    Duke Energy (DUK +0.3%) says it considers new conditions imposed by federal regulators on its...

    Duke Energy (DUK +0.3%) says it considers new conditions imposed by federal regulators on its planned takeover of Progress Energy (PGN +3.6%) as a positive development that would allow it to close the deal by the July 1 target. The FERC on Friday cleared the way for the $13.7B deal but added conditions, including asking for periodic reports on the status of transmission upgrades.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:22 AM
  • GRMN

    Garmin (GRMN -5.1%) could be a victim of Apple's pending iOS update, warns Oppenheimer. The firm...

    Garmin (GRMN -5.1%) could be a victim of Apple's pending iOS update, warns Oppenheimer. The firm thinks Apple (NASDAQ:AAPL), which is expected to unveil a proprietary mapping solution this week at its developer conference, will also follow Google's lead in including turn-by-turn mobile navigation services with its mobile OS, thereby causing further damage to the handheld/automotive GPS market.

     
     
     
     
    | 10:20 AM | 3 Comments
  • NVDA

    Nvidia (NVDA +2%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from UBS' Uche Orji, who's keeping his PT...

    Nvidia (NVDA +2%) trades higher on an upgrade to Buy from UBS' Uche Orji, who's keeping his PT at $15.50. Aside from the drop in Nvidia's multiples, Orji likes Nvidia's positioning in the market for ARM-based Windows 8 devices; its 28nm Kepler graphics processors (GPUs), and its high-margin professional solutions business, which centers around the company's Quadro GPUs. (previous)

     
     
     
     
    | 10:09 AM | 1 Comment
  • MLNX

    Mellanox (MLNX +7%) jumps after announcing its InfiniBand adapter chips will be used by Intel...

    Mellanox (MLNX +7%) jumps after announcing its InfiniBand adapter chips will be used by Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) in server motherboards and I/O expansion modules supporting the company's Romley server CPU platform. The deal follows a recent design win with H-P,  and comes a few month after Mellanox shares slumped on fears Intel's acquisition of QLogic's InfiniBand business would create new competition. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 9:51 AM
  • LHCG

    LHC Group (LHCG -3.5%) decides to remain independent, ending a strategic review the home health...

    LHC Group (LHCG -3.5%) decides to remain independent, ending a strategic review the home health and hospice services provider began last year. LHCG says it may repurchase up to $50M of its outstanding shares with cash on hand or borrowings under debt facilities. TPG Capital reportedly had considered making an offer for the company.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:48 AM
  • NOK

    Nokia (NOK -2.8%) trades lower after Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) shoots down rumors it's interested in...

    Nokia (NOK -2.8%) trades lower after Samsung (OTC:SSNLF) shoots down rumors it's interested in buying the struggling mobile giant. While Nokia's IP, brand, and manufacturing expertise could be of value to Samsung, the integration challenges of any deal would be immense, and regulators might not be thrilled to see it happen.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:39 AM | 7 Comments
  • GMCR

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) +1.6% premarket as supermarket chain Kroger (NYSE:KR) says...

    Green Mountain Coffee (NASDAQ:GMCR) +1.6% premarket as supermarket chain Kroger (NYSE:KR) says it plans to introduce store-branded single-serve coffee cups compatible with GMCR's Keurig brewers. The news comes on top of Starbucks' earlier announcement that its stores will begin selling single-serve K-Cups on June 12.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:29 AM | 1 Comment
  • ZAZA

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA) +1.5% premarket after announcing it will receive an immediate $15M...

    ZaZa Energy (OTC:ZAZA) +1.5% premarket after announcing it will receive an immediate $15M payment to end an agreement with Hess (NYSE:HES) to explore and develop the Eagle Ford shale formation, agreeing to pay down $100M senior secured notes due 2017 by $33M, and engaging Jefferies to lead a JV process for ZaZa's Eagle Ford core and Woodbine/Eaglebine assets.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:22 AM

  • Market preview: While U.S. futures and EU shares pare some of the gains that followed the...

    Market preview: While U.S. futures and EU shares pare some of the gains that followed the €100B rescue of Spain's banks, the real action is taking place in the peripheral bond markets, where Spanish 10-year bond yields are +20 bps and those of Italy +16 bps. S&P futures +0.9%. In corporate news, Energy Solutions -19% and Forest Labs -4% after profit warnings (I, II). Later: Apple Worldwide Developer Conference, Fed Speak
     
     
     
     
    | 9:15 AM
  • NOIZ

    Premarket gainers: NOIZ +94%. INMD +22%. AMPE +11%. MLNX +8%. NAV +7%. Losers: CNC -29%. DMND -6%.

    Premarket gainers: NOIZ +94%. INMD +22%. AMPE +11%. MLNX +8%. NAV +7%.
    Losers: CNC -29%. DMND -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 9:05 AM
  • AKS

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.1% premarket after Goldman cuts shares to Sell, seeing "continuing...

    AK Steel (NYSE:AKS) -2.1% premarket after Goldman cuts shares to Sell, seeing "continuing weak flat steel prices, a highly leveraged balance sheet, high pension funding requirements, high capex to fund its raw material strategy, and no sign of a turnaround in its lucrative electrical steel end market." Dahlman Rose also downgrades AKS to Hold and reduces 2012 estimates.

     
     
     
     
    | 9:04 AM
  • DMND

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -4.5% premarket after the company says it won't meet Nasdaq's...

    Diamond Foods (NASDAQ:DMND) -4.5% premarket after the company says it won't meet Nasdaq's quarterly report filing deadline. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:35 AM
  • CNC

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -23.9% premarket after the Medicaid insurer cuts its full-year EPS forecast...

    Centene (NYSE:CNC) -23.9% premarket after the Medicaid insurer cuts its full-year EPS forecast to $1.45-$1.65 vs. its previously announced range of $2.64-$2.84, reflecting higher-than-expected medical costs in Kentucky and Texas as well as in its Celtic unit. CNC warns of an additional potential writedown.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM
  • AMPE

    Ampio (NYSEMKT:AMPE) shares are +10.9% after it reported positive results from a small trial for...

    Ampio (NYSEMKT:AMPE) shares are +10.9% after it reported positive results from a small trial for Optina, a diabetes-related drug that is taken orally. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:28 AM
  • MRCY

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY) agrees to acquire Micronetics (NASDAQ:NOIZ), a maker of...

    Mercury Computer Systems (NASDAQ:MRCY) agrees to acquire Micronetics (NASDAQ:NOIZ), a maker of radio and microwave frequency subsystems and components, for $14.80/share, in a deal valued at ~$75.4M. NOIZ +94.3% premarket.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:22 AM
  • INMD

    IntegraMed America (NASDAQ:INMD) +21.6% premarket after agreeing to be taken private by Sagard...

    IntegraMed America (NASDAQ:INMD) +21.6% premarket after agreeing to be taken private by Sagard Capital Partners for $14.05/share, or $169.5M, a 24% premium to Friday's closing price.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:14 AM
  • FRX

    Forest Labs (NYSE:FRX) shares are -7.5% after it cuts its FY 2013 EPS guidance to $0.65-$0.80,...

    Forest Labs (NYSE:FRX) shares are -7.5% after it cuts its FY 2013 EPS guidance to $0.65-$0.80, well below consensus of $1. Forest Labs cited sharply lower-than-expected sales of its Lexapro treatment following the expiration of the drug's patent in March this year. (PR)

     
     
     
     
    | 8:12 AM
  • ES-OLD

    EnergySolutions (NYSE:ES-OLD) -6.7% premarket after naming board member David Lockwood as new...

    EnergySolutions (NYSE:ES-OLD) -6.7% premarket after naming board member David Lockwood as new CEO and lowering its 2012 EBITDA outlook to $130M-$140M from $150M-$160M.

     
     
     
     
    | 8:05 AM | 1 Comment

  • Weakness in Spanish and Italian bond markets turns into a rout, Spain's 10-year note now +23 bps...

    Weakness in Spanish and Italian bond markets turns into a rout, Spain's 10-year note now +23 bps to 6.45%, Italy's 10-year +24 bps to 6.01%. Madrid +1.1% after being 4.5% higher earlier. Milan -0.6%. S&P futures at session lows, +0.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:44 AM | 12 Comments

  • European markets jump up, U.S. futures follow suit. London +1.5%. Paris +2.1%. Frankfurt +2.2%....

    European markets jump up, U.S. futures follow suit. London +1.5%. Paris +2.1%. Frankfurt +2.2%. Madrid +4.5%. U.S. futures: Dow +1.1%. S&P +1.1%. Nasdaq +1.1%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:20 AM | 3 Comments
  • SAN

    Spanish banks get the expected bounce this morning, following the sector's bailout. In Madrid,...

    Spanish banks get the expected bounce this morning, following the sector's bailout. In Madrid, Santander +7%, BBVA +8.5%, Bankinter +15%, CaixaBank +10%. Spain's IBEX 35 index opens +4.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 AM | 1 Comment
